By default now, when an Agent goes to Add a Comment, the text box is filled with:
Hi [firstname] [lastname],
– [Agent Full Name]

There are two requests I'd like here:
1. I want to be able to change the template for this.
2. I have to delete all this information, and then enter in my desired comment if I want to comment internally. I'd like to select which type of Comment this is, Customer (use template) or Internal (don't use template), and then hit OK to submit the comment.

Following on from JSD-98

The base functionality has been added, so that a JIRA Administrator can set an announcement for the Help Center / My Requests page. And a JIRA or Project Administrator can set an announcement for the portal level.

This is to allow the Administrators to give permission to agents to modify these announcements.

Things to decide:

* Are agents only given permission to edit projects they are agents for, or can they also be allowed to edit the global Help Center / My Requests announcement?
* How will this look in the interface? Currently these settings are behind admin permission checks, so a display will be needed that allows agents to change the announcement but no other settings.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3267].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users that do not have the JIRA Administrator Global Permission are able to make Permission Scheme changes.

# Login as a user with the JIRA Global Permission of at least JIRA Administrator or more.
# Modify the Service Desk Project Permission Scheme. In this case, we removed all users from having the Permission to Delete Issues. Some organizations have the requirement to NOT Delete any Issues in their Service Desk Project.
# Login as a User that DOES NOT have the JIRA Administrators Global Permission, but is a Service Desk Project Admin.
# This User will receive a Yellow and White Pop-up box that says: "This service desk project may not work as expected. View details and repair the problem"
# This User receives the "Permission scheme error" with the button "Upgrade Permission Scheme". The User that DOES NOT have the JIRA Administrator Global Permission clicks this button.
# The ability to Delete Issues has been _added back_ to the Permission Scheme.

h3. Suggested Solution
Only allow users that have been granted the JIRA Administrator Global Permission - just as it is in JIRA Core Projects - be able to modify Permission Schemes. No other users with lesser JIRA Global Permissions should have the ability to see the "Upgrade Permission Scheme" button, and be able to make changes to a Permission Scheme.
 
h3. Workaround 
Only have Project Admins that you want to be able to modify Permission Schemes be able to be Service Desk Project Admins. This is not the case with JIRA Core Projects. In JIRA Core Projects, you can have a Project Administrator NOT have to have the JIRA Administrator Global Permission. Those Project Admins do not have the ability to make changes to Permission Schemes. This should be the case with Service Desk as well.
fields.summary: Users without the proper Global Permissions should not be able to Upgrade the Permission Scheme

Cloud

# Add another goal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3254].
  {panel}

At the moment, Open/Closed requests in the Customer Portal is determined by the Resolution.

If a request has a resolution, it will be in *Closed requests*. If it doesn't have a resolution, it will be in *Open requests*. The status of request will not matter.

In certain situations, it would be better if the Open/Closed requests will look at the Status of the request, instead of the resolution.

For example, an agent will propose a resolution for the request (by setting a resolution) but will still need confirmation from the user. Only when the user agrees and transition the request to Closed should the request be considered closed and appear in *Closed requests*
fields.summary: Resolved issues are visible in customer portal in 'Closed requests'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3232].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
There will be multiple WARN stack traces in the logs in regards of JIRA Service Desk Automation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.
# Create two Service Desk Project, e.g. SD A and SD B.
# On "SD B" navigate to the _Project Administration > Automation_.
# Create a "Reopen on Customer Comment" rule and confirm.
# Run the following Query:
{code:sql}
select p.id,p.pname,pr."PROJECT_ID",rl."NAME",rl."DESCRIPTION",wh."MODULE_KEY" from "project" p 
right join "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" pr on (p.id = pr."PROJECT_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rl on (pr."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rl."RULE_SET_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_WHEN_HANDLER_CONFIG" wh on (rl."ID" = wh."ID");
{code}
# There will be a result for each project Automation Rule.
# Navigate to "SD B" project administration and delete the project.
# Create a Request in "SD A" and Resolved the ticket.
# As the Reporter, access the ticket in "Customer Portal" view and comment on the ticket.

h3. Expected Result:
* Nothing happen as there is no "Reopen on Customer Comment" rule in "SD A" without any stack trace in the logs.

h3. Actual Result:
* Nothing happen as well but there will be a WARN stack trace like below written in the logs.
{code}
2016-01-01 20:44:14,471 http-nio-8705-exec-4 WARN admin 1244x2604x1 1rreza0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/customer/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error error.retrieving.project : 'error.retrieving.project'
2016-01-01 20:44:14,471 http-nio-8705-exec-4 WARN admin 1244x2604x1 1rreza0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/customer/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error error.retrieving.project : 'error.retrieving.project'
2016-01-01 20:44:14,471 http-nio-8705-exec-4 WARN admin 1244x2604x1 1rreza0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/customer/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error error.retrieving.project : 'error.retrieving.project'
{code}

h3. Notes:
* Run the same query below and there will be an automation rule that did not have any project specified as it is deleted:
{code:sql}
select p.id,p.pname,pr."PROJECT_ID",rl."NAME",rl."DESCRIPTION",wh."MODULE_KEY" from "project" p 
right join "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" pr on (p.id = pr."PROJECT_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rl on (pr."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rl."RULE_SET_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_WHEN_HANDLER_CONFIG" wh on (rl."ID" = wh."ID");
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2016-01-01 at 6.25.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
* If we delete an existing Automation Rule while the Project is still exist, the row about that automation rule will still be exist.
* Tried to do the same for an Automation Rule that is deleted while the Project is still exist could not replicate the same stack trace to be thrown.
* This is WARN stack trace, it should not affect JIRA operations as it is a WARNING.
fields.summary: Automation throws 'error.retrieving.project' WARN stack traces in the logs.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3231].
  {panel}

In JIRA Service Desk Cloud. 

h3. Problem Definition

Currently site-admin count toward a licence seat for JSD. This is because in order to manage JSD a user has to have application access to JSD. 

h3. Suggested Solution

For a site-admin to have application access to JIRA Service Desk without counting toward a license count. This would allow a JIRA site-admin to have the ability to administer a JSD project and not have to pay additional licensing cost.  

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment. User must be able to access JSD in order to administer JSD projects.
fields.summary: Allow for JSD site-admin to manage the application without counting toward a license seat

  {panel}

h3. Summary:
If we attach an empty text file on the Request form, a Warning Banner will appear. But, the warning did not disappear even when the right file is attached on the request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Add the "Attachment" field on one of the Request Type.
_Service Desk Project Administration > Request Types > select the Request > Edit fields_
# Navigate to the Customer Portal and select the request type
# Create an Empty Text File and select it on the form.
# A warning will appears.
# Attach another Text File that is not empty.

h3. Expected Result:
* The warning will disappear and the file is attached.

h3. Actual Result:
* The file is attached and the warning still appears.

h3. Notes:
* If the warning did not disappear, at least it should behave like it will automatically disappear even though there is no file attached yet.
fields.summary: Warning Banner still appear after attaching the right File on the request form.

h5. Problem definition
Currently when an e-mail has more than 255 characters on the mail field, it will not be processed by JIRA Service Desk mail channel. No error is thrown to the original sender and message is not processed. 
On a regular JIRA mail handler, the e-mail will be truncated and processed, although.

h5. Suggestion
Allow processing more than 255 characters or, at least, notify the original sender when the e-mail is not processed.

fields.summary: JIRA mobile interface cannot handle anonymous users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3206].
  {panel}

Hi,
In our service desk project an agent get the issue and sometimes he handle it by creating external issue to other jira project, the SD issue change the status to pending external and the external issue has link to the SD issue.
Today, all the collaborators have browse permission to all SD issues.
What we would want is the collaborators to have browse permission only to the SD issues that have link to project in which the collaborators have browse permission.
Is it possible? Do you have something like it? Or maybe you have other suggestion that can help us to prevent from collaborators to see issues that are not related to them.
fields.summary: Collaborators can only see SD issue that are link to project which related to them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3205].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When connecting a Service Desk project to a HipChat room, if we filter the configuration to issue types, operations carried out by customers are not generating notifications in HipChat.

It still works with agents or when there's no filter.

h3. Environment
* HipChat Cloud.
* Tested in 7.1.0-OD-02-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project with an issue type, say ‘IT Help’
# Connect with HipChat
# Set a room to be notified on comments in the project and filter by ‘IT Help’
!hc_config.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue of type ‘IT Help’
# Log in as an agent and comment on the issue
# Log in as a customer and comment on the issue

h3. Expected Results
Both comments generate a notification in HipChat.

h3. Actual Results
Only the comment made by the agent generates notifications.
 
h3. Notes
This is similar to this bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/HCPUB-38

However, that bug seems to happen regardless of filter and it’s created for JIRA Server and HipChat Server.

h3.Workaround
*Partial Workaround*
Set issue types match to all.
fields.summary: HipChat room is not notified for customer operation if Service Desk project filters by issue type

Using Service desk it is important to get a quick overview of a case, and to see what comments have been made internally and externally.
At the moment we can see internal comments based on the little label in the upper right side of the the comment.

However it would be even more clear to see what comments are internal, if we had a formatting tool for the internal and external comments.
So I could set the settings to for example show all internal comments with Italic text or with a light blue background.

  {panel}

We have multiple projects both internally and external with Kanban board.
You Support department with service desk is one of the.
When selecting a kanban card in our service desk board, I see the reporter and assignee in the top of the quick view in the right side.
However I would like to be able to change the assigned person in the quickview like I can do when I have the entire case opened in full screen.

We are using service desk with Kanban board.
With this setup we often select a case and see the details in the quick view in the right side of the kanban board.

However under comments it is not possible to see if a comment is internal or not.
This can only bee seen from opening the case fully.
Both internal and external comments are shown, but there is not a clear indicator for which comment is internal for our developers and which is external for the customer.

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk incoming mail handlers have pre-configured rules that prevent them from processing automatically generated messages (e.g. auto-responses or delivery status bounces), to avoid mail loops.
h3. Suggested Solution
To be able to create issues from automatically generated emails with configuration to switch of auto response to avoid mail loops.
fields.summary: To Be Able to Create Issues By OneDesk Help Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3192].
  {panel}

Currently we use a ticketing system that allows us to reply to emails, CC and BCC customers.

I cannot seem to do this in JSD due to the following:

- There is no CC/BCC field
- There is no ability to add additional requestors who are not users in the system
- There is no ability to add watchers or request participants who are not users in the system.

Is there something I am missing?  We often send outage notifications out to customers, CC a companies tech along side the original requesters etc. etc.

I do not wish to add accounts for every single person I want to email, have them sent multiple emails asking them to create accounts, being added as participants along side the original correspondence.

What is the solution to this or am I using the wrong software?
fields.summary: Complete email gateway replacement

  {panel}

At the moment there are three actions in utomation: transition issue, add comment and alert user. I'd like to suggest adding actions that can edit the issue. It would be great to have an action that could edit the request type, add a tag or system, add watchers, etc.

Use case:
We are currently in the process of adopting Service Desk for inhouse use (customers are coworkers, IT department of the company) and while the customer portal will work nicely for the more complicated issues but we expect the majority of tickets will come in via email. To reduce administration work (ie every ticket via email would have to be given a priority, systems/components added, etc) I'd want to do all this with automation.

I'm aware there is the possibility of adding custom actions by developing a plugin for automation, but I think editing some properties of issues should be a default option.
fields.summary: Add Automation Actions that can edit/change issues

  {panel}

Currently, when raising an issue via the portal, the "Customer Request Type" is set automatically according to the type of issue created via the portal.

When viewing an issue created this way, the Service Desk request section shows:
Request Type: Service Request (for example)
Customer Status: Open (for example)
Channel: Portal

However, if a Service Desk Agent logs the request via the normal Jira interface, this is not set.

When viewing an issue created via Jira interface the Service Desk request section shows:
Request type:	No match
Channel:	JIRA

There is a pull-down menu which can be used to set the Request Type here.  In our configuration there is only ever 1 type of Request Type which is applicable to any particular issue type.  If this is the case, why not set it automatically.

Alternatively, expose the option to set the Request Type on the creation screen.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a JIRA Service Desk project's Knowledge Base is linked to a Confluence Space, the search feature that appears within the Customer Portal to find potential solutions through the KB does not provide autocomplete results unless a full word is entered. The search field displays {{Please enter at least 3 more characters}}, however unless the full word entered is three characters in length, the autocomplete feature does not provide any results until a full word is entered.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for partial word search when entering the first three+ characters of a word. This should also return mid-word results as well, assuming the characters entered are not the first three.

h3. Workaround
Type in a full word for the search
fields.summary: Add Support for Partial Word Search within the Customer Portal KB Search's Autocomplete Feature

h3. Summary

When the _Default Outgoing Email Format_ is set to _text_, {{Satisfaction Feedback}} is not added in the resolved email notification.

h3. Steps to reproduce 

# Navigate to {{https://<instance URL>/secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa}}

Set _Default Outgoing Email Format_ to {{html}}

h3. Summary

h3. Environment
* EACJ - JIRA - v7.0.3#70112-sha1:392d476

h3. Steps to Reproduce
I want to create a ticket in a project so I:
# Click the project in the drop down
# Click create (issue) button
# The project does not exist in the create issue drop down

h3. Expected Results
* The desired project was selected or at least available in the drop down.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3147].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever a customer sends an email to a Service Desk which has public signup enabled, the customer in question will receive an email back in order to proceed with the signup process for the Service Desk account.
In some use cases, the Service Desk environment should not be accessible for the customers, meaning that all issue communication should be running through email *alone*, and the customer essentially is not "aware" of having an account in the Service Desk environment.

h3. Suggested Solution
In order to prevent the customer from being aware an account has been created, the reply mail that gets sent whenever a first request has been raised should not be sent out by Service Desk. Please make this a configurable option for administrators.
fields.summary: As and administrator, I want to be able to disable the reply mail when a non existing user creates an issue through mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3146].
  {panel}

Submitting a request on behalf of customer:

Satisfaction Feedback is a way we measure how satisfied the customer with the service and to improve the Service levels. In a common scenario, here is how it works:
# Customer send an email for some enquiries
# Support engineer pick it up and answer all the questions
# Once all question answered, the ticket is closed/resolved
# System sends Satisfaction Feedback through an email to customer to see how happy they are with the service

{quote}
Until step 4 we are good.
1. Customer wants to review / update the rating he has provided for
whatever reason
2. Customer wants to see ratings of the closed tickets
{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to review the Satisfaction Feedback and update it

As a project admin, I'd like to be able to manage the "smarts" pre-populated texts on the comment section of an issue when an agent responds to a customer. 

When talking about manage, I mean:
- Set myself a default message.
- Set specific messages for each project.
- Enable/disable this feature as I like.

*Workaround to disable*

Enable the following dark feature from https://<instance-url>/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa: (in Cloud Atlassian Support will need to do this)

{noformat}
sd.email.conversational.notification.disabled
{noformat}


{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 12 October 2015}
Hi all,

We have added an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the 3.0.1, 3.1.0-OD-01 release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}

{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 4 September 2015}
Hi all,

Thank you for all your feedback. Before launching this new feature, our goal was to make service desk notification more conversational. We’ve made a decision to move forward with helping agents save time with a friendly greeting and sign off with the agent name to make it more personal. We acknowledge that this functionality isn't for every agent and your desire to customize these responses.
So far we've added additional translation strings for German, French and Japanese. 
You can also help us in translating for your language here if it is missing https://translations.atlassian.com/. 
The string are:

{noformat}
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.greeting=Hi {0},
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.anonymous.greeting=Hi,
{noformat}

The ability to edit these responses will require a bit more thought, the immediate action for us is to provide an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the upcoming release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.If you have further questions or comments, please feel free to contact me directly as well at jhuynh at atlassian dot com.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow admins to manage pre-populated texts on JSD.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3132].
  {panel}

When the same userkey appears in 2 different user directories, and those 2 users have different group access, it can sometimes not be possible to assign that user to an issue (as can not be searched for in user picker).

*Steps to reproduce*

# Create 2 users in different user directories with same username (should also then be same userkey)
# The user within the directory id with lowest id (normally JIRA internal) is not a member of the service-desk-agents group
# The other user is a member of the group
# The group with highest id (probably not the JIRA Internal) is higher in order of priority
# Try to assign that user to a Service Desk issue that they should be an agent in

*Expected*

* The user can be assigned to the issue

*Actual*

* The user can not be found or assigned
fields.summary: Problem assigning a user to an issue when same userkey in 2 directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3130].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In many registration processes for applications, it is custom to provide a confirmation box to re-type the password during the account creation.
The JIRA Service Desk registration process currently does not have this.

h3. Suggested Solution
Could you please provide a password confirmation box in the registration process, or provide the option to Administrators to configure this?
fields.summary: Provide a password confirmation box in the Service Desk registration process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3129].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Company policy can dictate that the username for applications are required to have a certain format, for instance:
* email address
* initials.lastname
* etc

h3. Suggested Solution
As an administrator, I want to be able to set restrictions to the format of the usernames created for my Service Desk environment
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to set restrictions on username format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3128].
  {panel}

Scenario:  Trying to forward an email so that the body of the email becomes a comment to an existing service desk ticket, and so that any attachments get attached to the ticket.

What I have tried:  Manually typed the issue key (eg ABC-123) into the email's subject line and forwarded to the email address for which I have configured the Service Desk mail handler.

Expected Result: A comment in the service desk ticket which contains the text of the email.

Actual Result: An empty (blank) comment in the service desk ticket.
fields.summary: forwarding an email with an issue key on subject line to service desk mail handler yields empty comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3126].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Create In-App notifications when the JIRA Service Desk Mail queue is congested or failing.
h3. Suggested Solution

In JIRA it is possible to raise alerts via In App Notifications, it would be good to have a notification raised for when the Mail queue is failing so that it can be easily brought to the Administrators attention. In particular in situations where customers rely on email as contact method the Administrators need to be aware as soon as possible that incoming mail is failing.
h3. Workaround

Manually review the Email Logs for failures.
fields.summary: In Application Service Desk Notifications for failing Queues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3121].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , JIRA doesn't support viewing SVG image from JIRA . So , admin would like to raised a feature to render SVG image to PNG image from JIRA . Then send email notifications using PNG format.

h3. Suggested Solution
Auto render SVG image format to PNG when adding comment or attachment.

h3. Workaround 
Download the files from attachment then view it using SVG supported application or via online . For example http://www.rapidtables.com/web/tools/svg-viewer-editor.htm .
fields.summary: As admin, would like SVG image format render to PNG format when sending email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3120].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
A JIRA Project will provide a link to the project components in the sidebar of the project summary at {{<baseurl>/projects/<projectkey>/summary}}

This option is not available under Service Desk projects

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a link to the same page for the components under a Service Desk project as currently available under the JIRA projects
 
h3. Workaround 
Despite the link not being available under the Service Desk project page, the page itself does still exist.
You can navigate to it with the following instructions:
{{<baseurl>/projects/<projectkey>?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:components-page}}
Replace the {{<baseurl>}} segment with the base url of your instance.
Replace the {{<projectkey>}} segment with the project key of the Service Desk project
fields.summary: Components link missing in Service Desk project view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3118].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
Pressing {{CTRL+Enter}} in JIRA Comment field will submit the comment to other users.

However, in a JIRA Service Desk, an *Internal Comment* will be added if {{CTRL+Enter}} is pressed.

*Requested Behaviour*
Allow user to configure/change the outcome of keyboard shortcut so pressing {{CTRL+Enter}} would share with customer instead of adding internal comment.
fields.summary: Allow users to configure keyboard shortcut {{CTRL+Enter}}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3116].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It's not possible to have different SLAs for the same level based on different calendars. For example, if an issue is created during business hours I'd like the SLA to be set to 15m for a given level, and outside business hours I'd like the same issue/level to be created with a higher SLA, let's say 1 hour.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have two calendars (configurable) one for business hours and another for the rest of the day.
fields.summary: Different SLA policy during and outside business hours (Configurable)
Change the Priority of the issue according to the Request type
Interface for managing Request Type Groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3108].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It currently is not possible to change the log file location for Service Desk.
This causes issues when an environment with multiple applications require their log files to be centralized.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a similar option as available for the atlassian-jira.log file as described in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/logging-and-profiling-185729617.html] document 
h3. Workaround 
There currently is no workaround available to move the file in question
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to change the log file location of atlassian-servicedesk.log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3106].

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Some project's menus such as _Compoenents_ and _Release_ are only accessible in Project Administration page.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to add these menus to the project navigation panel (without having to go to Project Administration page), regardless of project type
fields.summary: Having the option to add project related menus to project navigation panel
